image.altText: Signs outside Redcliffe Hospital.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers sensational allegations by a whistleblower that dozens of expectant mothers who attended a Queensland hospital received substandard maternity care that put their babies' lives at risk and did not follow official clinical guidelines.

title.children: Hospital received multiple warnings about flawed care before baby deaths

image.altText: Noa hug dad

props.synopsis: The IDF says the hostages were rescued from the Al-Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, where Palestinian authorities say at least 210 Palestinians have been killed and 400 wounded in an Israeli bombardment.

title.children: Four Israeli hostages rescued in IDF operation that left hundreds dead in central Gaza

image.altText: A man wearing a blue cap, polo shirt, cargo shorts and sunglasses opens his backpack on a beach

props.synopsis: Clare Bailey Mosley says her family won't lose hope as the search for Michael Mosley continues for a third day.

title.children: Michael Mosley's wife says the days have been 'unbearable' since TV doctor went missing

image.altText: A young baby wrapped in a blanket with medical monitoring equipment attached to various parts of its body.

props.synopsis: The saga started in 2017, and this week, a court challenge revealed new details about three newborns left within kilometres of each other in east London. The "extremely rare" occurrence has put the spotlight on child abandonment — a phenomenon some say is poorly understood.

title.children: Three babies were abandoned in London over seven years. A DNA test revealed a devastating truth

image.altText: A man is crying while he hugs two female family members.

props.synopsis: Israeli troops rescued four hostages on Saturday, eight months after they were kidnapped from a music festival.

title.children: Here's what we know about the four hostages rescued from Gaza

image.altText: Travis Head plays a shot

props.synopsis: A brilliant powerplay sets the tone as Australia completes a comfortable victory over arch-rivals England at the T20 World Cup.

title.children: Australia demolishes England in T20 World Cup clash after stunning opening partnership

image.altText: Portrait of a woman with her white, small, vintage car.

props.synopsis: Meg Grealy says her car attracts attention every time she takes it out for the day and has opened the door to a new world.

title.children: Meg can only drive Mighty Boy for 60 days a year, but it's a head-turner wherever she goes

image.altText: A young white boy doing a backflip on a trampoline

props.synopsis: Experts say emerging research shows a link between risky play and less psychological distress in adolescent years. Could this be part of the solution to the current teen mental health crisis?

title.children: It sounds deceptively simple — but 'risky play' could be one of the fixes to a generational crisis

image.altText: Caroline laying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Nearly 16 years ago, Caroline Southcott got up to go to the toilet on a flight from Singapore to Perth. As she was returning to her seat, she suffered severe injuries that continue to impact her to this day.

title.children: Caroline was a seasoned flyer who wore her seatbelt on long-haul flights. Then she got up to go to the bathroom

image.altText: A woman smiling while she holds a baby at the beach

props.synopsis: From having babies on their own to choosing to be single, these Australians believe life isn't necessarily easier — or better — with a partner.

title.children: Has marriage become outdated in 2024? These Australians think so

image.altText: Two men in wetsuits stand together near water

props.synopsis: Loved ones pay tribute to Australian brothers Callum and Jake Robinson, who were killed alongside their American friend Jack Carter Rhoad during a surfing trip in Mexico.

title.children: Brothers Callum and Jake Robinson farewelled at emotional memorial service

image.altText: A woman in a grocery isle of fruit and vegetables

props.synopsis: There's a growing divide in the prices of goods, and it's making the Reserve Bank's job harder. But the federal budget's cost-of-living measures may buy the RBA more time.

title.children: If inflation is falling, why are prices of essentials still rising so quickly?

image.altText: A young woman in a white top and black jacket is led into a courtoom by a blue-uniformed female guard.

props.synopsis: A beautiful young American in Italy. A brutal murder. Tales of sex games and occult rituals. The trial of Amanda Knox had all the elements of a salacious tabloid story, but at the core of the case lay a bungled investigation and an overeager prosecution — and some uncomfortable truths about how society treats young women.

title.children: Amanda Knox was convicted, then acquitted, of a brutal murder. Here's why her story still captivates audiences across the globe

image.altText: An illustration of the clitoris.

props.synopsis: Largely overlooked by medical science for centuries, these women set out to advance the knowledge of the clitoris.

title.children: Don't know much about the clitoris? The International Cliteratti will help

image.altText: Various heart symbols including the modern hearbreak emoji, collaged over a photo-realistic style paiting of a heart.

props.synopsis: The heartbreak emoji is a near-universal symbol, but it hasn't always been that way. So how else was heartbreak depicted in art, and where did our modern version come from?

title.children: We all know the emoji, but did you know it once symbolised syphilis? The history of the broken heart

image.altText: Barbed wire and a high fence pictured against a sunset

props.synopsis: Some people sitting on the Queensland Parole Board were not properly appointed, bringing into question some of their decisions, the ABC understands.

title.children: Calls for Queensland government to 'come clean' about parole board after administrative error

image.altText: A person holds a phone looking at the TMR rego renewal website.

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles has promised a cost of living budget but it'll come with a deficit — a deliberate move the government says will help people who are struggling.

title.children: A $453 million budget promise will save Queenslanders 20 per cent on their car rego this year

image.altText: A man and woman standing in front of a green background

props.synopsis: The couple are at the confluence of how governments are responding to climate change and what is appropriate clean energy development.

title.children: Win and Jim live in a tropical paradise. Their home could soon be flooded for the 'greater good'

image.altText: Graphic of man in high vis with an arrow pointing to him dressed in a black polo

props.synopsis: Gen Z and millennials are job hopping much more frequently than their boomer bosses in the pursuit of happiness — and it's putting pressure on employers.

title.children: Gen Zs like Flynn are happy to career hop until they find a job that makes them happy

image.altText: A man working in a  dairy shed.

props.synopsis: While you question whether to pay $13 for a block of cheese at the supermarket, the dairy farmers who produce the milk to make that cheese are questioning whether they can stay in the industry.

title.children: You're paying more for milk, but the farmers who produce it are getting paid less

image.altText: Man with a hi vis vest looks at bottles in a factory.

props.synopsis: From a more efficient furnace to increased recycling, a South Australian glass plant is moving to cut its energy use to provide savings for itself and potential benefits to other users. And it's qualified for a new efficiency scheme.

title.children: Making wine bottles takes a lot of energy. This glass plant is aiming to make the process more efficient

image.altText: Woman wearing pink collared shirt and Akubra hat holds a camel's halter. The camel is leaning in for a kiss on the nose.

props.synopsis: Robyn Davidson and Sophie Matterson trekked through Australia, each with a caravan of wild camels, 30 years apart. Now they return to the outback to create new tracks.

title.children: Tracks through the generations: Robyn Davidson and Sophie Matterson on their outback journeys

image.altText: A composite of two photos of girls with long black hair looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A film adapted from a true story that has been watched nearly 6 million times appears to have prompted police to pursue the suspects of a murder that happened eight years ago — but the case is far from over.

title.children: Supernatural twist and a horror film linked to arrest of lead suspect in Indonesian cold murder case

image.altText: Several nuclear power cooling chimneys emit steam.

props.synopsis: The federal Coalition confirms it will dump Australia's commitment to reduce emissions by 43 per cent by 2030, arguing the target is unachievable.

title.children: Federal Coalition commits to dumping 2030 climate target as it pursues nuclear power

image.altText: A for lease sign in front of a house

props.synopsis: With standardised contracts, signing a lease doesn't need to be as stressful as the search for a rental property. Experts share the red flags to look out for to ensure you're getting the real deal.

title.children: Red flags to look out for when signing rental lease agreements

image.altText: A court sketch of Naomi biden. Her black hair is tied in a bun and she's wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden's daughter has testified in her father's defence that he seemed to respond well to drug treatment in the weeks before he bought a gun that prosecutors say he obtained illegally by failing to disclose his addiction.

title.children: 'I'm really sorry dad, I can't take this': Hunter Biden's daughter testifies about his drug use at his criminal gun trial

image.altText: Marion Scrymgour

props.synopsis: Senator Lidia Thorpe has levelled scrutiny on the Northern Land Council over the spending of hundreds of thousands of dollars in federal COVID stimulus funding.

title.children: 'I've got nothing to hide': Federal MP reacts after accusations of misusing COVID funding

image.altText: The Right wave

props.synopsis: This legendary surf break scares even the most experienced big-wave riders as it creates mountains of water, whipped up during wintry low pressure systems in the Southern Ocean.

title.children: Winter storms spark monster swell at 'the gnarliest, scariest place on Earth'

image.altText: A man looks out over choppy surf from a viewing platform.

props.synopsis: The man aged in his 40s went missing yesterday afternoon after being spotted struggling at Surfers Point, Prevelly.

title.children: Fears grow for surfer missing in rough seas off WA beach

image.altText: Three St Kilda AFL players celebrate against the Gold Coast Suns.

props.synopsis: Umpiring decisions are under the microscope again after the Saints edge the Suns by three points, the Kangaroos record their first victory of the season and the Hawks extend their winning run.

title.children: Hardwick labels late free kick 'unwarranted' in Suns' loss to Saints, controversy erupts in Roos' win

image.altText: Siosifa Talakai of the Sharks makes a run, with ball in hand, a defender on the ground, and a teammate in support

props.synopsis: The Cronulla Sharks scored three tries in a devastating seven-minute spell to overcome a half-time deficit to defeat the Brisbane Broncos 22-12.

title.children: Broncos play 'worst half of football' as Cronulla bulldoze their way to win at Lang Park

image.altText: Skiers look over to the opposing mountain ridge

props.synopsis: Away from the sunburnt beaches, hot dusty gums, and red deserts, news for Australia's ski fields hasn't been good for years. But new research shows while the snow season is getting shorter, there's hope to turn things around.

title.children: Australia's ski fields are on a downhill slope, but scientists show there's an off-ramp

image.altText: Lyudmila Oluanovska passes a celebrating Laura Garcia-Caro

props.synopsis: The shocking moment when Spanish race walker Laura García-Caro loses a possible European Championship bronze medal after celebrating too early.

title.children: Watch the shocking moment when a walker loses a race celebrating too early
